oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter written by Elizabeth Merriwether Deberry with a post script by Allen Deberry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this letter Elizabeth Deberry discusses events in Madison and Haywood Counties, Tennessee. The post script is written by her husband and he discusses the sale of "30 to 40 negroes." He also discussed his mill and 1000 acres of land. She discusses planting peas in the garden and how the weather has been as well as a number of local marriages. She anticipates that her trip to Memphis and New Orleans may be cancelled due to cholera on the Mississippi River.
